This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

Hi @ankit-db , I am an ml engineer who uses MLflow in my personal projects and day-to-day work heavily. There was a use case for interacting Sagemaker Batch Transform with MLflow in my recent project, so I implemented the Python APIs and the CLI supports. I noticed this Feature Request has not been implemented yet. I would like to discuss my design with you and create a PR once you approve.

Design for the MLflow Sagemaker Batch Transform integration:
1. The API that deploys the model as a Sagemaker batch transform job: 
Since the batch transform job needs to have a unique name, it first checks whether the provided name has already been existing. If no, then it uploads the model from the MLflow artifact to S3 and creates a Sagemaker model. After that, it creates the transform job with the provided parameters via boto3 API. If synchronous=True, it will keep monitoring the process and returning logs until it passed the timeout seconds. 
`mlflow.sagemaker.deploy_transform_job(job_name, model_uri, s3_input_data_type, s3_input_uri, content_type, s3_output_path, compression_type='None', split_type='Line', accept='text/csv', assemble_with='Line', input_filter='$', output_filter='$', join_resource='None', execution_role_arn=None, bucket=None, image_url=None, region_name='us-west-2', instance_type='ml.m4.xlarge', instance_count=1, vpc_config=None, flavor=None, synchronous=True, timeout_seconds=1200)`
Please notice synchronous follows the same logic as the other existing APIs.

2. The API that terminates the Sagemaker batch transform job with the specified name:
It terminates the transform job with the provided name via boto3 API. If archive=False, it will delete the model as well as the model artifact in S3. Both synchronous and timeout_seconds have the same logic as the other APIs.
`mlflow.sagemaker.terminate_transform_job(job_name=None, region_name='us-west-2', archive=True, synchronous=True, timeout_seconds=300)`
I also include the CLI support for the above APIs. Detailed info will be provided in the document.

Please let me know what you think. I will create a PR once you agree.

Thanks

Thanks @YQ-Wang and others for pointing out that this would be useful support to add! I think it'd make sense for us to look to the community for design/implementation help on this so thanks for taking that initiative. I'll make an action item for myself to review this with the team and will spend some time thinking about the batch transform API and get back to you with questions
